reviews.review_msg: She claims her tests are fair but it's not, you need to do 60 questions (which is mc and written) under an hour, the ta's for that class also pmo, tutorials are useless, her grammer is so bad u don't understand the questions on the test, the slides are useless its all pictures, lectures are basically pointless, don't take the class with her

Tests are ridiculous, 50 MC along with 36 points worth of long answers. The test is to be completed in 50 minutes. Do not take this class with her if you can help it. During lectures Megan fails to teach properly. Megan is late and untidy nearly everyday.

her tests are way too long for a fifty minute period. it takes her 10 minutes to get everyone settled and hand out the test and then she yaps for another five minutes. the multiple choice questions are worded so weirdly and the grammar is off on so many questions. you'd think that since she's white her grammar would be better, but it's not.

Cannot teach, she does this feedback about the course thing every week where we spend 30 minutes on it, and yet she doesn't even take the feedbacks seriously, you're gonna be so confused in class if you dont read 20+ pages she assigns due next day. Don't get me started with pre class quizzes. Don't take the class with her

she cannot teach so she makes us read like over thirty pages of notes every single class. class time is wasted by her saying “talk to your partner” like can you just teach us something?? and don't even get me started on the iclickers. they are so useless, they don't help at all but you need to show up or you don't get the marks. dont take her class

Hi all, 

I'd say to you don't take this class. She is a very difficult prof to deal with. She says one thing and brings another in exam. The slides are just pictures not helpful. Does not explain well. Only a lot of participation. Don't take with her.

Megan was a great prof for 101. Her lectures are built around engagement, so showing up and doing the i-Clickers is definitely a must. It can be challenging balancing everything that needs to be done for this course at once, but if you keep up, do work as it comes and really try to understand - (not memorize) - you'll do great with her!
so baddie nice
Megan is great,  a lab with her was a dream come true. She is so caring.

Dr. Barker is a great prof! She's very understanding, extremely helpful during labs, and always explains things clearly. The final exam for the lab portion was based completely on the labs done during lab time and on the lab manual given at the beginning of the semester. She's very understanding if you hand something in late, which is nice.

First of all, do not take this course with her if you are not ready to read. I taught myself 95% of this course, by reading the textbook and doing practice questions. Lectures were useless and I only attended to get my iClicker marks. Megan cannot teach, class time was wasted on clickers and "discuss with the person beside you."
Cant teach so she tells everyone to read the whole textbook. Lectures are pointless but theres Iclicker. She always talks about how she prioritizes teaching but the class average is a C+

Energetic and uses lecture time well, focus is placed more on building on the readings than retreading them. She provides a lot of study material to prepare for tests and lectures and is refreshingly transparent about what's going on behind the scenes. There are boring points in the course itself but that's more on the material than her.

Megan is passionate for biology and cares for her students, however her lecture slides do not cover the majority of what is testable. Lectures are very slow paced and not many concepts are covered within the given time, there are too many group activities and slow I-clicker questions. Instead it is expected to read all of the "weekly readings".

Although she was always quite helpful in class, the way she scaled the grades was ridiculous even after getting perfect on pretty much everything I got a B+, which is quite irritating because this class was not easy and required a lot of hard-work. I would avoid taking this class with her if you actually care about your grades and cgpa.

Good proffesor but does use grade scaling religiously, in a bad way. An A- turned to a mid B. I haven't experienced scaling like this before by any proff, its usually only couple percent scaled up or down in other courses. No heads up either like hey you are about to drop 2 grades by end of course at 84%. Atleast give us a chance to improve.

Ok first off, as a person she is amazing with good teaching abilities and seems very caring. HOWEVER be careful in her class, it may seem easy but she unexpectedly hard scales the class. 86% was a B at the end even though her grading scheme clearly mentions A- to be 82%.She made the A- range to be the B range and A range to be B+. Barely got an A-

Megan is a nice prof, caring, and really likes feedback so she can improve her teaching. However the course content itself doesn't really match with the lectures going on in BISC 101 lecture. I had her for the lab portion and she was nice but the lab exam was rushed as hell. 8 questions with like 4 parts was legit death. content is easy

Dr. Megan is an awesome professor. She really cares about her students and is really easy going. The labs are not too complicated. She tells fun stories at the beginning of the class. Overall a really nice person and an awesome professor.
Dr. Barker was the most interesting professor I have had so far, she cares about her students and is passionate about biology. I wish I had her for more classes.

She's amazing, caring and kind. Her labs help explain the course material and she gave the option for bonus marks rather than betting everything on the final exam. The homework isn't so bad, seeing how you have a week to do it. Then during class time, you get to work on an extension of the lab with your group. She explains things well.

Megan was my lab instructor for BISC101. Overall, she made the course way more fun and interesting and her "pre-lab talks" were very nice. I could tell she cared for us and our wellbeing, especially given how weird everything is online. The lab portion of the course was alright... Not my favourite, but it wasn't bad either! Megan was awesome :)

Megan was the lab coordinator for the class, so I didn't see/hear much from her that semester but any videos I did see of her she was super friendly. Some lab preps were a tad difficult so I strongly suggest starting on them the day of or day after they come out. The labs were more relaxed, and TAs were more than willing to help out.
Really nice, you can tell she cares. Helpful pre-lab discussions, labs not too hard. My favourite prof this term.

Dr. Barker is an amazing professor! She tries to engage with students and is always really enthusiastic. She gives two optional projects that can help bump up your grade which shows that she really cares about her students. The pre labs are a bit long sometimes but the labs are fine. Overall, totally recommend taking a class with Dr. Barker!

Overall Megan was a really good prof. Although she was often late to the lab, her pre-lab talks were very informative and she explained concepts really well. Equal participation between group members is really important in her lab class.

Megan is sweet, caring and willing to adapt. She can be disorganized at times, but she's very open for comments and feedbacks, tho sometimes a little slow. Explains concepts very thoroughly and wants to make sure that everyone is on the same page. Inspires us to love Biology the way she does. Definitely one of the best profs I've ever had. Jolie

Megan is very kind and approachable, but she just wasn't very good at her job. Started semester off with a very different syllabus than at the end. Takes FOREVER to get any sort of feedback whatsoever. Most learning is done in lengthy textbook readings, lectures don't go into very much detail. The course was stressful due to disorganization.

This is a class that makes you work for it. If you put in the work you will see results & one of the plus points of Megan is that she doesnt let your marks only be affected by the tests (theyre spread out). This class has its downsides but if you work hard you can end strong! Read the textbook!!! Memorize it if you have to!

Took this class in summer online. Awful experience, do not take it with her. Notes + lectures  useless. Need to memorize textbook and self teach if you expect a decent grade. She gave the hardest practice exam and exam questions (when I searched up a few practice answers, they were recycled from previous UBC second and third year bio courses).

This was a pretty standard class considering you had to work hard for your grade. You really need to know the material to do good on the tests and I recommend basing your studying off the textbook mainly. Other than that, the only annoying thing was the lab preps/post labs were way too long and midterms/assignments take forever to get graded.

I cannot say enough nice things about Megan, she is probably the best prof I've had at SFU! Very approachable and down to earth, I always felt comfortable asking her about pretty much anything! 408W is a 4th year lab course so obviously it's not going to be a piece of cake. But Megan makes it easier to excel in this course, and you learn a lot!

Megan is super funny, her lectures are engaging! But if you are an introvert this may not be the professor to take this class with. Every lecture you are forced to "discuss with people around you" and do group worksheets. The midterm and final both had "group" components too. But Megan is really great at explaining concepts and is a good prof!

Megan is so so kind and very willing to answer any questions you may have. She's a new prof so she still understands the struggles students face. Her lectures are fun and connect well with the lab portion of the course. Her tests are very fare and she has multiple avenues to receive feedback from students so she knows what to focus on in lecture.

If Erin Barley is teaching BISC 101 then take her instead!! She was way better than Megan!! Megan has harder tests and sometimes more complex "apply your thinking" questions, and Erin has straightforward easy ones!! First midterm for Megan I got 53% and for Erins i got 73%!!!! Take Erin instead!

Megan is a great prof. She pays attention to detail in the course structure and is open to student engagement and suggestions. The targeted reading guides she gives are very helpful and save time when preparing for class. She's funny and tries her best to make lectures fun. She is very enthusiastic when teaching.
Super nice and engaging. Teaches the material well in a way that makes you remember and understand it. Tests and marking was fair.

Super nice prof and decent course (101) if you do all the readings and take notes. Lectures aren't super helpful but you get clicker marks so... Barker is really accessible outside of class too, and very easy to chat with and clarify knowledge. She appreciates when students clearly put work in before coming to see her, and will be more helpful

The course overall is not that hard but her grade scale is so weird. 10% tutorial quiz and 10% midterm. Idk how the midterm portion is same as the quiz portion and the midterm is much harder than the quizzes. And we have another midterm worth 15% and one lab exam one final. Basically we are preparing exam and quiz every week. So much pressure.
Did not explain things in detail

Amazing prof who cares a LOT. Tests are relatively tough. A lot of independent studying, but she's always ready to help and spend however much time you need to help clarify and answer questions. If you take advantage of her office hours, you will find the course very enjoyable and easy to get through. If you don't, you might find it quiet hard.

Course is tailored for students who thrive on independent study. Exams are quite difficult and require lots of attention to detail. The course is definitely manageable but you need to put work in extra effort as she doesn't cover everything in lecture. Super cool and funny person though, really cares about her students and is very engaging.

Dozens of assignments that are all worth a small percent of your grade. This professor has a strong belief that students should learn everything on their own. This course is manageable but be prepared to Google everything.

Super helpful and personable!! Makes the lectures engaging and fun, not too serious and helps you really understand the material. Midterms and exams are quite detailed and challenging though, lot's of hypothetical thinking
Amazing Prof. that actually care about student's opinion. Her lecturers are straight forwarded and easy to understand.

One of my fave profs. Her lectures are engaging, and she only focuses on the material students find difficult (we filled out a feedback quiz each week). Although she's super nice, I had to work very hard for an A. Pre-class readings are definitely mandatory with megan, and exams were fairly difficult. But, if you put in the work you should be fine.

Last comment, if you want to do well in this class, read my past comments 08/16, ignore the whiny students who did poor because of their lack of effort, finding ways to get back at this amazing prof.  I will tell you right now the only thing close to being 'unfair' is the amount of time given for the Final lecture exam, it was just awfully long.

For the guy commenting on Botox pillar, that was only an example around a concept you ALREADY learned in class, it had nothing to needing outside class material to answer the question.  For the guy commenting on having to read the book, get real, this is a university level course, you expect people to hold your hands all the time?

THE MOST CARING AND LOVING BIOLOGY PROFESSOR IN THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD. I LIKED HER SO MUCH, I SOMETIME WISH SHE WAS MY MOM SO I CAN HAVE QUALITY DISCUSSION ABOUT THE WORLD WITH HER BECAUSE SHE KNOWS SO MUCH ABOUT EVERYTHING. ON TOP OF THAT SHE'S STILL STUDYING DESPITE HAVE HER MASTER. BEST WISHES ON YOUR NEWBORN MEGAN, THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING!

I already commented, but here are study tips: -Do pre-reading one week in advance for the online quiz -Take lecture notes in class -Review textbook notes + lecture notes at end of every week -Do all practice exams (THIS IS CRUCIAL) -Ask TAs for help + attend office for free answers to practice exam -Do pre- AND in-lab activities BEFORE lab

I knew NOTHING coming into this course. A lot of first year students were crying about exams being unfair, and for me this is NOT TRUE! If I came out on top knowing nothing to start, why can't you? Do not expect to be babied in this course like most first year courses, you HAVE TO READ, you HAVE TO DO EXTRA RESEARCH.  MEGAN IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!

I've been at SFU for 5 years and I can definitely say Megan is an AMAZING professor. The course is well structure in terms of course layout and study method, if you don't work hard, you will NOT do well. This means pre-read all the readings a week ahead, and do extra research on the side. It's also EXTREMELY important to do all her practice exams.

her exams are not related to what you read and learn. One of the shocking questions is that she was asking about Botox pillar treatment when I learned Digestion, Respiration/Circulation, Neurons and Signals, Muscles. Might be related concepts but for me, it doesn't make any sense to ask that to freshman students. We are not doctors.

This is one of those profs that makes you work your ass off for a good grade, but cares so much about her subject and inspires you to love Biology. Her lectures have group discussions and activities and are the most engaging I've had at SFU so far. She focuses a lot on her teaching methods, and it shows. Difficult course, but so worth it.

Megan was the highlight of my First semester at SFU. She expected you to do the pre readings and have a grasp of the concepts before coming to lecture, and she went over the basis of everything you needed to know. Her tests were fair, maybe a little long but very, very similar to her practice exams. Get ready to read, but you need to go to lectures

This course is based off of you doing the prereadings, and if not you are screwed for exams because you can't study off her lecture slides as they are just pictures! Bio with her is a self taught course. Nobody has time to study the lengthy and useless readings, recommended. She does not believe in curving (heads up). I had to retake the course!

She is so awesome. Scaled the final exam (over 100% was awarded to multiple students) Many questions on the final were minor variations on her practice exams. She's awesome, take her course, work hard, keep on top of your readings. She can't upload her brain onto yours, stop blaming her when you can't answer her questions - they are fair.

Megan Barker was is my favourite prof at SFU. I managed to get a B in this course ONLY because her lectures were so chills. She made you like biology and gave so many examples. If you engage in lectures, do the readings (she tells you exactly what to read) you will do well in the course. BTW I got a C- in BISC 102 with a different prof. SHE DA BEST

Amazing prof! She was one of my favourite profs at SFU and after taking her BISC 101 class, all the other profs pale in comparison. She puts lots of effort into her slides, students, and activities. Time flew by in her lectures! But beware, you will have to work to get a good grade.

Don't take this class with her. Her lectures are so boring she makes you do group work in the lectures and it usually doesn't make sense. Get ready to read. The midterms/final is different from what you are taught so get ready to pull allnighters. This course is way to heavy to be a first year course.

Both midterms and final exam were fair if you studied the textbook in depth (read the things she says to skip lol). Some exam questions have a ridiculous amount of jargon that could be cut down to make the question more clear. Kind professor, but pushes group activities to the point of irritation. One lecture, she only got through 1 slide. :/
Amazing prof! Easy A if you study well for midterms and final! Very fair tests! Provides lots of office hours for extra help if needed!

Very passionate prof, and clearly knows the material and loves to teach others about biology; covers a lot of material in lecture & a lot of reading for pre-class quizzes.  Tests are very long but fair - know your stuff really well so that you can complete the entire test.

She is very enthusiastic and passionate about biology,  I honestly really enjoyed attending her lectures, even tho she does not cover a lot of difficult concepts during lectures . But her tests are hard you have to memorize EVERYTHING and be fast at reading and answering questions. She puts a lot of effort into teaching.

AMAZING LECTURES and her knowledge and excitement for the material made the class even better! I learned so much in her lectures and although the pre readings may seem tedious at times, they really help solidify your understanding of the material we go through in class. Please take her class if you can, it was awesome!
Avoid. Wastes time.  Tests are not fair. I don't want to take any more biology classes thanks to her.

expects to complete exams with a minute for each question even tho majority voiced that it wasnt reasonable for us, she didnt take our suggestion and kept exams lengthy and material on exams was unexpected compared to what we covered in lecture.

I strongly disagree with the many people saying that Megan's expectations were unclear. I wish that all of my professors cared enough to make detailed reading outlines that explicitly state what to skip and what is fair game for testing. Megan is an exceptional instructor who goes above and beyond but demands her students work at hard as she does.

Her exams were challenging but fair, really makes you work for a good grade, but the averages were pretty normal for first year science courses. She gives lots of office hour times before exams and is very approachable. Her lectures were decent and her enthusiasm for the course material made the class enjoyable.

Her passion and enthusiasm is amazing in all of her lectures. She knows how to engage the class and always looks for feedback on her teaching. She gives good summaries in lectures but her exams require work on your own to grasp the details. She gives very good support though.

She's a very nice person, and easy to talk but.. but she can't teach  very well. Her lectures are based on the easier / easiest concepts, and she doesn't spend any time time on the material she tests you on.. Which leads me to say her tests don't make sense more than half the time. Don't waste your time with her class, save your GPA

Megan is one of the best profs i have ever had! She is enthusiastic and clearly explains all concepts we cover in class. Some people expect to be able to just show up to class and get an easy A, Thats not the case. The pre readings are necessary as they teach you the basic concepts that she continues on. Tests are long but similar to the practice.

On the exams I found myself reading these paragraph long questions with so much malarkey, only to realize I  just spent 5 minutes reading a multiple choice question. Lectures were simple, briefly explaining a few concepts out of many from the entire chapter. Exams are brutal, average is about 50-60%. No curving/scaling of grades. GL you'll need it.

Exams are very wordy and you usually run out of time for them. Pre-reading is mandatory but prof goes over concepts in class anyways. Doesn't cover material similar to tests, only teaches the basics so be ready to go searching for other study material.
very long exams, not quite helpful lectures.

Loved her as  a person, not so much as a prof. She spent a lot of time trying to inspire her class to study and work in groups, as well as discussions outside of bio rather than the actual material. She was extremely accessible though, lots of hours and although her tests were a little wordy, they were pretty fair.

Exams are very wordy and long so you would run out of time often. Lectures are very general while exams are very specific which is not helpful. Workload is heavy and need to review often to not fall behind. Tries to make class entertaining but wastes time and not helpful in long run. Must study extra to do well in class. Long readings + quizzes.

Dr. Barker spent enormous amounts of lecture needlessly interacting with the crowd. The small amount of time left over barely allowed us to advance past the simple concepts from the pre-reading, and into difficult exam type examples. For a student to be successful in this course, a large amount of time must be spent seeking other learning sources.

Take a different section if you can.  Wastes time in lectures on simple topics, just tries to do too much to make biology cool. The wording on pre-reading q's is often misleading, and whether you've done the reading or not won't matter because she will quiz on abstract stuff , but then spend the whole lecture talking about the easy stuff.

Megan spends too much time thinking about how she will look cool to the students then actually caring if she does well.  Her exams are too long, with questions bogged down by useless words and she spends a lot of time in lectures wasting time about the little things, but quizzing the most obscure details in the reading for that week.  AVOID

Megan is an amazing prof! Being a first year, I found the workload quite heavy and hard to keep up with, but it definitely pays off if you do.  Lots of iclickers and group worksheets, which make the lectures more engaging.  Midterms are tough but fair and very similar to the practice questions that she gives.

Megan takes lectures not as a opportunity to build on the specifics from the prereading we were assigned, but to revisit 1-2 simple concepts. Often times you will find yourself going 50 min without writing anything bc she doesnt present anything above a bio 12 level There is a huge misalignment between test material and what is presented in lecture

Her lectures are amazing and really well prepared. Class work is engaging and she works well with the lab instructors and TAs. Megan's passion for biology shines each lecture and she makes you really get into proteins (her favourite haha). Very approachable! Exams are hard, as to be expected in a bio course, but be prepared and you'll be fine.

Such an inspiration for women into STEM and super passionate about biology & biochemistry. I'm an arts student but she's making me think of switching to science! Be prepared (do ALL the pre-reading and practice q's) and don't be shy to talk to her and ask questions, & you will succeed. She's very approachable and has the geekiest/nerdiest humor.

This professor gives amazing lectures and she is clearly very passionate about biology, however, I would switch professors if I could.  If someone does all the required pre-readings, takes notes from the txts and goes to lectures they should get a good grade.  NOT.  The pre-reading  q's and m/c midterm q's were confusing, and midterm was too long!
